2269def plot_curve_1d(
2270    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2271    name: str,
2272    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2273    **kwargs,
2274) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2275    r"""
2276    Plots a 1D curve (usually marginalized Gaussian) from a Fisher object.
2277
2278    Parameters
2279    ----------
2280    fisher : FisherMatrix
2281        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2282
2283    name : str
2284        the name of the parameter which we want to plot
2285
2286    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2287        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2288        plots to a new figure.
2289
2290    **kwargs
2291        any keyword arguments passed to `matplotlib.pyplot.plot`
2292
2293    Returns
2294    -------
2295    A 3-tuple `(Figure, Axes, Artist)`
2296        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2297        the artist itself.
2298
2299    Examples
2300    --------
2301    Define a Fisher matrix:
2302    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2303    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2304    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2305    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2306    ... )
2307
2308    Draw the marginalized parameter `a`:
2309    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_1d(m, name='a', ls='--', color='red')
2310
2311    Save it to a file:
2312    >>> fig.savefig(
2313    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_1d_example1.png",
2314    ... dpi=100)
2315
2316    <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/plot_curve_1d_example1.png">
2317    """
2318    if ax is None:
2319        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2320
2321    fid = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name)]
2322    sigma = fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True)
2323
2324    return _add_plot_1d(fid, sigma, ax=ax, **kwargs)
2325
2326
2327def plot_curve_2d(
2328    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2329    name1: str,
2330    name2: str,
2331    ax: Optional[Axes] = None,
2332    scaling_factor: float = 1,
2333    **kwargs,
2334) -> tuple[Figure, Axes, Artist]:
2335    r"""
2336    Plots a 2D curve (usually ellipse) from two parameters of a Fisher object.
2337
2338    Parameters
2339    ----------
2340    fisher : FisherMatrix
2341        the Fisher matrix which we want to plot
2342
2343    name1 : str
2344        the name of the first parameter which we want to plot
2345
2346    name2 : str
2347        the name of the second parameter which we want to plot
2348
2349    ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes, optional
2350        the axis on which we want to plot the contour (default: None). If None,
2351        plots to a new figure.
2352
2353    **kwargs
2354        any keyword arguments passed to `matplotlib.patches.Ellipse`
2355
2356    Returns
2357    -------
2358    A 3-tuple `(Figure, Axes, Artist)`
2359        The figure and the axis on which the artist was drawn on, as well as
2360        the artist itself.
2361
2362    Examples
2363    --------
2364    Define a Fisher matrix:
2365    >>> m = FisherMatrix(
2366    ... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
2367    ... names=['a', 'b'],
2368    ... fiducials=[1, -2],
2369    ... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
2370    ... )
2371
2372    Draw the 1$\sigma$ contour of the parameter combination `a`, `b`:
2373    >>> fig, ax, artist = plot_curve_2d(m, name1='a', name2='b', ls='--', color='red', fill=False)
2374
2375    Rescale the view a bit:
2376    >>> _ = ax.autoscale()
2377    >>> _ = ax.relim()
2378    >>> _ = ax.autoscale_view()
2379
2380    Save it to a file:
2381    >>> fig.savefig(
2382    ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "plot_curve_2d_example1.png",
2383    ... dpi=100)
2384
2385    <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/plot_curve_2d_example1.png">
2386
2387    Notes
2388    -----
2389    The limits of the plot are not updated automatically.
2390    """
2391    if ax is None:
2392        _, ax = plt.subplots()
2393
2394    fidx = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name1)]
2395    fidy = fisher.fiducials[np.where(fisher.names == name2)]
2396
2397    a, b, angle = _get_ellipse(fisher, name1, name2)
2398
2399    patch = ax.add_patch(
2400        Ellipse(
2401            xy=(fidx, fidy),
2402            width=2 * a * scaling_factor,
2403            height=2 * b * scaling_factor,
2404            angle=angle,
2405            **kwargs,
2406        ),
2407    )
2408
2409    return (ax.get_figure(), ax, patch)
2410
2411
2412def _get_ellipse(
2413    fm: FisherMatrix,
2414    name1: str,
2415    name2: str,
2416) -> tuple[float, float, float]:
2417    """
2418    Constructs parameters for a Gaussian ellipse from the names.
2419    """
2420    if name1 == name2:
2421        raise ValueError("Names must be different")
2422
2423    # the inverse
2424    inv = FisherMatrix(fm.inverse(), names=fm.names)
2425
2426    sigmax2 = inv[name1, name1]
2427    sigmay2 = inv[name2, name2]
2428    sigmaxy = inv[name1, name2]
2429
2430    # basically the eigenvalues of the submatrix
2431    a = np.sqrt(
2432        (sigmax2 + sigmay2) / 2 + np.sqrt((sigmax2 - sigmay2) ** 2 / 4 + sigmaxy**2)
2433    )
2434
2435    b = np.sqrt(
2436        (sigmax2 + sigmay2) / 2 - np.sqrt((sigmax2 - sigmay2) ** 2 / 4 + sigmaxy**2)
2437    )
2438
2439    angle = np.rad2deg(
2440        np.arctan2(
2441            2 * sigmaxy,
2442            sigmax2 - sigmay2,
2443        )
2444        / 2
2445    )
2446
2447    return a, b, angle
2448
2449
2450def _mark_fiducial_1d(
2451    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2452    name: str,
2453    ax: Axes,
2454    npoints: int = 100,
2455    autolim: bool = False,
2456    **kwargs,
2457):
2458    # only need to draw a vertical line on 1D plots
2459    x_vline = np.repeat(
2460        fisher.fiducials[np.where(name == fisher.names)][0],
2461        npoints,
2462    )
2463
2464    y_vline = np.linspace(0, 1e5, npoints)
2465
2466    vline = LineCollection(
2467        [np.column_stack((x_vline, y_vline))],
2468        **kwargs,
2469    )
2470
2471    ax.add_collection(vline, autolim=autolim)
2472
2473
2474def _mark_fiducial_2d(
2475    fisher: FisherMatrix,
2476    name1: str,
2477    name2: str,
2478    ax: Axes,
2479    npoints: int = 100,
2480    autolim: bool = False,
2481    **kwargs,
2482):
2483    index1 = np.where(fisher.names == name1)[0]
2484    index2 = np.where(fisher.names == name2)[0]
2485    fiducial1 = fisher.fiducials[index1]
2486    fiducial2 = fisher.fiducials[index2]
2487
2488    # drawing the horizontal line
2489    x_hline = np.linspace(
2490        fiducial2 - fisher.constraints(name2, sigma=100)[0],
2491        fiducial2 + fisher.constraints(name2, sigma=100)[0],
2492        npoints,
2493    )
2494    y_hline = np.repeat(fiducial1, npoints)
2495
2496    hline = LineCollection(
2497        [np.column_stack((x_hline, y_hline))],
2498        **kwargs,
2499    )
2500
2501    ax.add_collection(hline, autolim=autolim)
2502
2503    # drawing the vertical line
2504    x_vline = np.repeat(fiducial2, npoints)
2505
2506    y_vline = np.linspace(
2507        fiducial1 - fisher.constraints(name1, sigma=100)[0],
2508        fiducial1 + fisher.constraints(name1, sigma=100)[0],
2509        npoints,
2510    )
2511
2512    vline = LineCollection(
2513        [np.column_stack((x_vline, y_vline))],
2514        **kwargs,
2515    )
2516
2517    ax.add_collection(vline, autolim=autolim)

class FisherBarFigure(_FisherBaseFigure): 
 636class FisherBarFigure(_FisherBaseFigure):
 637    """
 638    Container for plotting single-axis bar-like figures
 639    (`plot_absolute_constraints` and `plot_relative_constraints`)
 640    """
 641
 642    def _parse_fractional_constraints(
 643        self,
 644        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 645        marginalized: bool = True,
 646        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 647        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 648        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 649        percent: bool = False,
 650        space: float = 0.3,
 651        scale: str = "linear",
 652    ):
 653        # error handling
 654        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 655            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 656
 657        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log", "symlog"]
 658        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 659            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 660
 661        for arg in args:
 662            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 663                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 664                    "parameter name",
 665                    args[0].names,
 666                    arg.names,
 667                )
 668
 669        # total number of parameters in the Fisher objects
 670        size = len(args[0])
 671
 672        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 673        total_space = 1 - space
 674
 675        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 676        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 677
 678        if not colors:
 679            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 680        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 681            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 682
 683        if not labels:
 684            labels = [""] * len(args)
 685        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 686            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 687
 688        if not values_label:
 689            if percent:
 690                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$"
 691            else:
 692                values_label = r"$\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 693
 694        return _TempContainer(
 695            labels,
 696            colors,  # type: ignore
 697            [
 698                [
 699                    _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 700                    for _ in range(size)
 701                ]
 702                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 703            ],
 704            [
 705                np.array(
 706                    [
 707                        arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
 708                        for _ in arg.names
 709                    ]
 710                )
 711                / np.array(
 712                    [
 713                        np.abs(fid) if not np.isclose(fid, 0) else 1
 714                        for fid in arg.fiducials
 715                    ]
 716                )
 717                for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 718            ],
 719            space_per_object=space_per_object,
 720            values_label=values_label,
 721            scale=scale,
 722        )
 723
 724    def plot_absolute_constraints(
 725        self,
 726        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 727        kind: str,
 728        marginalized: bool = True,
 729        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 730        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 731        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 732        scale: str = "linear",
 733        space: float = 0.3,
 734        capsize: Optional[float] = None,
 735        **kwargs,
 736    ):
 737        r"""
 738        Makes a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices
 739
 740        Parameters
 741        ----------
 742        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
 743            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
 744
 745        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
 746            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
 747
 748        marginalized : bool, optional
 749            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
 750            be plotted (default: True)
 751
 752        colors : array_like of str, optional
 753            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
 754            colors)
 755
 756        labels : array_like of str, optional
 757            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
 758
 759        values_label : str, optional
 760            the label for the axis containing the constraints (default:
 761            `$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$`)
 762
 763        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
 764            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
 765
 766        space : float, optional
 767            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
 768
 769        capsize : float, optional
 770            the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined
 771            automatically)
 772
 773        **kwargs
 774            any keyword arguments passed to <a
 775            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
 776            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 777            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.bar`</a>, or <a
 778            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.barh.html"
 779            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 780            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.barh`</a>, or <a
 781            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.html"
 782            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
 783            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar`</a>.
 784        Returns
 785        -------
 786        None
 787
 788        Examples
 789        --------
 790        Define some Fisher matrices:
 791        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
 792        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
 793
 794        Make a vertical bar plot:
 795        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 796        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 797        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 798
 799        Save it to a file:
 800        >>> fig.savefig(
 801        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
 802        ... dpi=150)
 803
 804        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png">
 805
 806        Make a horizontal bar plot:
 807        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 808        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
 809        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 810
 811        Save it to a file:
 812        >>> fig.savefig(
 813        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
 814        ... dpi=150)
 815
 816        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png">
 817
 818        Make an errobar plot:
 819        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
 820        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
 821        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
 822
 823        Save it to a file:
 824        >>> fig.savefig(
 825        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
 826        ... dpi=150)
 827
 828        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png">
 829        """
 830        size = len(args[0])
 831        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
 832
 833        # error handling
 834        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
 835            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
 836
 837        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log"]
 838        if scale not in allowed_scales:
 839            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
 840
 841        for arg in args:
 842            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
 843                raise MismatchingValuesError(
 844                    "parameter name",
 845                    args[0].names,
 846                    arg.names,
 847                )
 848
 849        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
 850        total_space = 1 - space
 851
 852        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
 853        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
 854
 855        if not colors:
 856            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
 857        elif len(colors) != len(args):
 858            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
 859
 860        if not labels:
 861            labels = [""] * len(args)
 862        elif len(labels) != len(args):
 863            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
 864
 865        if not values_label:
 866            values_label = r"$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
 867
 868        x_array = [
 869            [
 870                _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
 871                for _ in range(size)
 872            ]
 873            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 874        ]
 875        y_array = [arg.fiducials for arg in args]
 876        yerr_array = [
 877            np.array(
 878                [
 879                    arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
 880                    for _ in arg.names
 881                ]
 882            )
 883            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
 884        ]
 885
 886        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
 887        options = {
 888            "bar": {
 889                "parameters_scale": "x",
 890                "values_scale": "y",
 891                "error_name": "yerr",
 892                "extra_kwargs": {
 893                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
 894                    "width": space_per_object,
 895                },
 896            },
 897            "barh": {
 898                "parameters_scale": "y",
 899                "values_scale": "x",
 900                "error_name": "xerr",
 901                "extra_kwargs": {
 902                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
 903                    "height": space_per_object,
 904                },
 905            },
 906            "errorbar": {
 907                "parameters_scale": "x",
 908                "values_scale": "y",
 909                "error_name": "yerr",
 910                "extra_kwargs": {
 911                    "capsize": total_space * 120 / len(args) / size,
 912                    "ls": kwargs.pop("ls", ""),
 913                    "marker": kwargs.pop("marker", "o"),
 914                },
 915            },
 916        }
 917
 918        if capsize is not None:
 919            options[kind]["extra_kwargs"]["capsize"] = capsize  # type: ignore
 920
 921        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
 922            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
 923            for color, label, x, y, yerr in zip(
 924                colors,  # type: ignore
 925                labels,
 926                x_array,
 927                y_array,
 928                yerr_array,
 929            ):
 930                getattr(ax, kind)(
 931                    x,
 932                    y,
 933                    color=color,
 934                    label=label,
 935                    **{options[kind]["error_name"]: yerr},
 936                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
 937                    **kwargs,
 938                )
 939
 940            ax.set_yscale(scale)
 941
 942            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
 943            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
 944                latex_names
 945            )
 946            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(values_label)
 947
 948        self._figure = fig
 949        self._axes = ax

 951    def plot_relative_constraints(
 952        self,
 953        args: Sequence[FisherMatrix],
 954        kind: str,
 955        marginalized: bool = True,
 956        colors: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 957        labels: Optional[Sequence[str]] = None,
 958        values_label: Optional[str] = None,
 959        scale: str = "linear",
 960        space: float = 0.3,
 961        percent: bool = False,
 962        **kwargs,
 963    ):
 964        r"""
 965        Makes a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the
 966        Fisher matrices
 967
 968        Parameters
 969        ----------
 970        args : array_like of FisherMatrix
 971            the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
 972
 973        kind : str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}
 974            the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
 975
 976        marginalized : bool, optional
 977            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should
 978            be plotted (default: True)
 979
 980        colors : array_like of str, optional
 981            the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib
 982            colors)
 983
 984        labels : array_like of str, optional
 985            the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
 986
 987        values_label : str, optional
 988            the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: `$\sigma /
 989            \theta_\mathrm{fid}$` if `percent` is false, otherwise `$\sigma /
 990            \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$`
 991
 992        scale : str, {'linear', 'log'}
 993            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
 994
 995        space : float, optional
 996            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
 997
 998        percent : bool, optional
 999            whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
1000
1001        **kwargs
1002            any keyword arguments passed to
1003            <a
1004            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
1005            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.bar`</a>
1006
1007        Returns
1008        -------
1009        None
1010
1011        Examples
1012        --------
1013        Define some Fisher matrices:
1014        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
1015        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
1016
1017        Make a vertical bar plot:
1018        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1019        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1020        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1021
1022        Save it to a file:
1023        >>> fig.savefig(
1024        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
1025        ... dpi=150)
1026
1027        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png">
1028
1029        Make a horizontal bar plot:
1030        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1031        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1032        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1033
1034        Save it to a file:
1035        >>> fig.savefig(
1036        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
1037        ... dpi=150)
1038
1039        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png">
1040        """
1041        size = len(args[0])
1042        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
1043
1044        computed_parameters = self._parse_fractional_constraints(
1045            args,
1046            marginalized=marginalized,
1047            colors=colors,
1048            labels=labels,
1049            scale=scale,
1050            space=space,
1051            values_label=values_label,
1052            percent=percent,
1053        )
1054
1055        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1056        options = {
1057            "bar": {
1058                "parameters_scale": "x",
1059                "values_scale": "y",
1060                "lines_prefix": "h",
1061                "extra_kwargs": {
1062                    "width": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1063                },
1064            },
1065            "barh": {
1066                "parameters_scale": "y",
1067                "values_scale": "x",
1068                "lines_prefix": "v",
1069                "extra_kwargs": {
1070                    "height": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1071                },
1072            },
1073        }
1074
1075        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1076            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1077            for color, label, x, y in zip(
1078                computed_parameters.colors,
1079                computed_parameters.labels,
1080                computed_parameters.x_array,
1081                computed_parameters.y_array,
1082            ):
1083                getattr(ax, kind)(
1084                    x,
1085                    y * 100 if percent else y,
1086                    color=color,
1087                    label=label,
1088                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1089                    **kwargs,
1090                )
1091                getattr(ax, kind)(
1092                    x,
1093                    -(y * 100 if percent else y),
1094                    color=color,
1095                    label=None,
1096                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1097                    **kwargs,
1098                )
1099
1100            limits = getattr(ax, f'get_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')()
1101
1102            getattr(ax, f'{options[kind]["lines_prefix"]}lines')(
1103                0, limits[0], limits[-1], color="black", ls="--"
1104            )
1105            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')(*limits)
1106            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}scale')(
1107                computed_parameters.scale
1108            )
1109
1110            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1111            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1112                latex_names
1113            )
1114            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(
1115                computed_parameters.values_label
1116            )
1117
1118        self._figure = fig
1119        self._axes = ax

749            whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should

761            `$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$`)
762

764            the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
765
766        space : float, optional
767            the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
768

771            automatically)
772
773        **kwargs
774            any keyword arguments passed to <a
775            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.bar.html"
776            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
777            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.bar`</a>, or <a
778            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.barh.html"
779            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
780            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.barh`</a>, or <a
781            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/_as_gen/matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.html"
782            target="_blank" rel=noreferrer
783            noopener>`matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar`</a>.
784        Returns
785        -------
786        None
787
788        Examples
789        --------
790        Define some Fisher matrices:
791        >>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
792        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
793
794        Make a vertical bar plot:
795        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
796        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
797        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

802        ... dpi=150)
803
804        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png">
805
806        Make a horizontal bar plot:
807        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
808        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
809        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
810
811        Save it to a file:
812        >>> fig.savefig(
813        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
814        ... dpi=150)
815
816        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png">
817
818        Make an errobar plot:
819        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
820        >>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
821        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
822
823        Save it to a file:
824        >>> fig.savefig(
825        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
826        ... dpi=150)
827
828        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png">
829        """
830        size = len(args[0])
831        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
832
833        # error handling
834        if not 0 <= space <= 1:
835            raise ValueError("The value of `space` must be in the open interval (0, 1)")
836
837        allowed_scales = ["linear", "log"]
838        if scale not in allowed_scales:
839            raise ValueError(f"The value of `scale` must be one of: {allowed_scales}")
840
841        for arg in args:
842            if set(args[0].names) != set(arg.names):
843                raise MismatchingValuesError(
844                    "parameter name",
845                    args[0].names,
846                    arg.names,
847                )
848
849        # the width or height of all columns for a single parameter
850        total_space = 1 - space
851
852        # the width or height of a single column for a single parameter
853        space_per_object = total_space / len(args)
854
855        if not colors:
856            colors = list(islice(self.current_color, len(args)))  # type: ignore
857        elif len(colors) != len(args):
858            raise MismatchingSizeError(colors, args)
859
860        if not labels:
861            labels = [""] * len(args)
862        elif len(labels) != len(args):
863            raise MismatchingSizeError(labels, args)
864
865        if not values_label:
866            values_label = r"$\theta_\mathrm{fid}$"
867
868        x_array = [
869            [
870                _ - total_space / 2 + (2 * index + 1) * space_per_object / 2
871                for _ in range(size)
872            ]
873            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
874        ]
875        y_array = [arg.fiducials for arg in args]
876        yerr_array = [
877            np.array(
878                [
879                    arg.constraints(name=_, marginalized=marginalized)[0]
880                    for _ in arg.names
881                ]
882            )
883            for index, arg in enumerate(args)
884        ]
885
886        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
887        options = {
888            "bar": {
889                "parameters_scale": "x",
890                "values_scale": "y",
891                "error_name": "yerr",
892                "extra_kwargs": {
893                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
894                    "width": space_per_object,
895                },
896            },
897            "barh": {
898                "parameters_scale": "y",
899                "values_scale": "x",
900                "error_name": "xerr",
901                "extra_kwargs": {
902                    "capsize": total_space * 60 / len(args) / size,
903                    "height": space_per_object,
904                },
905            },
906            "errorbar": {
907                "parameters_scale": "x",
908                "values_scale": "y",
909                "error_name": "yerr",
910                "extra_kwargs": {
911                    "capsize": total_space * 120 / len(args) / size,
912                    "ls": kwargs.pop("ls", ""),
913                    "marker": kwargs.pop("marker", "o"),
914                },
915            },
916        }
917
918        if capsize is not None:
919            options[kind]["extra_kwargs"]["capsize"] = capsize  # type: ignore
920
921        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
922            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
923            for color, label, x, y, yerr in zip(
924                colors,  # type: ignore
925                labels,
926                x_array,
927                y_array,
928                yerr_array,
929            ):
930                getattr(ax, kind)(
931                    x,
932                    y,
933                    color=color,
934                    label=label,
935                    **{options[kind]["error_name"]: yerr},
936                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
937                    **kwargs,
938                )
939
940            ax.set_yscale(scale)
941
942            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
943            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
944                latex_names
945            )
946            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(values_label)
947
948        self._figure = fig
949        self._axes = ax

Makes a plot of the constraints of the Fisher matrices

Parameters
  • args (array_like of FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
  • kind (str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}): the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
  • marginalized (bool, optional): whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should be plotted (default: True)
  • colors (array_like of str, optional): the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib colors)
  • labels (array_like of str, optional): the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
  • values_label (str, optional): the label for the axis containing the constraints (default: $\theta_\mathrm{fid}$)
  • scale (str, {'linear', 'log'}): the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
  • space (float, optional): the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
  • capsize (float, optional): the width of the errorbars (default: none, that is, determined automatically)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.bar, or matplotlib.pyplot.barh, or matplotlib.pyplot.errorbar.
Returns
  • None
Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
>>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])

Make a vertical bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_bar.png",
... dpi=150)

Make a horizontal bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_barh.png",
... dpi=150)

Make an errobar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_absolute_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'errorbar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'], capsize=4)
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_absolute_constraints_errorbar.png",
... dpi=150)

1015        >>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])
1016
1017        Make a vertical bar plot:
1018        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1019        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1020        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1021
1022        Save it to a file:
1023        >>> fig.savefig(
1024        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
1025        ... dpi=150)
1026
1027        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png">
1028
1029        Make a horizontal bar plot:
1030        >>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
1031        >>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
1032        >>> _ = fig.figure.legend()
1033
1034        Save it to a file:
1035        >>> fig.savefig(
1036        ... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
1037        ... dpi=150)
1038
1039        <img width="100%" src="$IMAGE_PATH/fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png">
1040        """
1041        size = len(args[0])
1042        latex_names = args[0].latex_names
1043
1044        computed_parameters = self._parse_fractional_constraints(
1045            args,
1046            marginalized=marginalized,
1047            colors=colors,
1048            labels=labels,
1049            scale=scale,
1050            space=space,
1051            values_label=values_label,
1052            percent=percent,
1053        )
1054
1055        # TODO: maybe put this in a class so validation is easier
1056        options = {
1057            "bar": {
1058                "parameters_scale": "x",
1059                "values_scale": "y",
1060                "lines_prefix": "h",
1061                "extra_kwargs": {
1062                    "width": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1063                },
1064            },
1065            "barh": {
1066                "parameters_scale": "y",
1067                "values_scale": "x",
1068                "lines_prefix": "v",
1069                "extra_kwargs": {
1070                    "height": computed_parameters.space_per_object,
1071                },
1072            },
1073        }
1074
1075        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1076            fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1077            for color, label, x, y in zip(
1078                computed_parameters.colors,
1079                computed_parameters.labels,
1080                computed_parameters.x_array,
1081                computed_parameters.y_array,
1082            ):
1083                getattr(ax, kind)(
1084                    x,
1085                    y * 100 if percent else y,
1086                    color=color,
1087                    label=label,
1088                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1089                    **kwargs,
1090                )
1091                getattr(ax, kind)(
1092                    x,
1093                    -(y * 100 if percent else y),
1094                    color=color,
1095                    label=None,
1096                    **options[kind]["extra_kwargs"],
1097                    **kwargs,
1098                )
1099
1100            limits = getattr(ax, f'get_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')()
1101
1102            getattr(ax, f'{options[kind]["lines_prefix"]}lines')(
1103                0, limits[0], limits[-1], color="black", ls="--"
1104            )
1105            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}lim')(*limits)
1106            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}scale')(
1107                computed_parameters.scale
1108            )
1109
1110            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticks')(range(size))
1111            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["parameters_scale"]}ticklabels')(
1112                latex_names
1113            )
1114            getattr(ax, f'set_{options[kind]["values_scale"]}label')(
1115                computed_parameters.values_label
1116            )
1117
1118        self._figure = fig
1119        self._axes = ax

Makes a plot of the constraints (relative to the fiducial) of the Fisher matrices

Parameters
  • args (array_like of FisherMatrix): the Fisher matrices for which we want to plot the constraints
  • kind (str, {'bar', 'barh', 'errorbar'}): the kind of plot we want (vertical bar, horizontal bar, errorbar)
  • marginalized (bool, optional): whether the marginalized or the unmarginalized constraints should be plotted (default: True)
  • colors (array_like of str, optional): the colors to use for the plotting (default: default matplotlib colors)
  • labels (array_like of str, optional): the labels for the Fisher matrices (default: None)
  • values_label (str, optional): the label for the values, that is, the y axis (default: $\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}$ if percent is false, otherwise $\sigma / \theta_\mathrm{fid}\ (\%)$
  • scale (str, {'linear', 'log'}): the scale used for the y axis (default: 'linear')
  • space (float, optional): the space reserved between the bars (default: 0.3)
  • percent (bool, optional): whether to plot in percentage units (default: false)
  • **kwargs: any keyword arguments passed to matplotlib.pyplot.bar
Returns
  • None
Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> fm1 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2, 3]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.3, 0.7, 0.96])
>>> fm2 = FisherMatrix(np.diag([4, 5, 6]) * 1e3, names=["a", "b", "c"], latex_names=[r'$\Omega_\mathrm{m}$', '$h$', "$n_s$"], fiducials=[0.35, 0.67, 0.9])

Make a vertical bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'bar', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_bar.png",
... dpi=150)

Make a horizontal bar plot:

>>> fig = FisherBarFigure()
>>> fig.plot_relative_constraints([fm1, fm2], 'barh', labels=['Fisher 1', 'Fisher 2'])
>>> _ = fig.figure.legend()

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure_plot_relative_constraints_barh.png",
... dpi=150)

options

Returns the matplotlib options which were used for plotting.

axes

Returns the axes of the figure as a numpy array.

figure

Returns the underlying figure, an instance of matplotlib.figure.Figure.

handles

Returns the handles of the currently drawn artists.

labels

Returns the legend labels of the currently drawn artists.

1247        """
1248        Implements drawing of other objects on the axis.

1250        Parameters
1251        ----------
1252        name : str
1253            the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
1254
1255        method : str
1256            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as `plot`,
1257            `scatter`, etc.)
1258
1259        *args
1260            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
1261
1262        **kwargs
1263            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
1264
1265        Returns
1266        -------
1267        Artist
1268            the artist that was drawn on the figure
1269
1270        Raises
1271        ------
1272        EmptyFigureError
1273            if `figure` is not set
1274        """
1275        if not hasattr(self[name], method):
1276            raise AttributeError(
1277                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
1278            )
1279
1280        # get the right color
1281        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1282            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1283            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1284
1285        # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection of
1286        # artists
1287        handles = getattr(self[name], method)(*args, **kwargs)
1288        if is_iterable(handles):
1289            for handle in handles:
1290                if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1291                    self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1292                    self.handles.append(handle)
1293        else:
1294            if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1295                self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1296                self.handles.append(handles)
1297
1298        self[name].autoscale()
1299        self[name].relim()
1300        self[name].autoscale_view()
1301
1302        return handles

1304    def plot(
1305        self,
1306        fisher: FisherMatrix,
1307        *args,
1308        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
1309        **kwargs,
1310    ):
1311        """
1312        Plots the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.
1313
1314        Parameters
1315        ----------
1316        fisher
1317            the Fisher object which we want to plot
1318
1319        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
1320            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
1321            (default: False). If set to `True`, uses `linestyles='--'` and
1322            `colors='black'` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
1323            keyword arguments as <a
1324            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/collections_api.html#matplotlib.collections.Collection"
1325            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
1326            noopener">`matplotlib.collections.Collection`</a>.
1327            If an empty dictionary, uses the default style (determined
1328            automatically).
1329
1330        **kwargs
1331            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as `plot_curve_1d`)
1332
1333        Returns
1334        -------
1335        None
1336        """
1337        size = len(fisher)
1338
1339        added = False
1340
1341        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
1342        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
1343        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1344            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1345            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1346
1347        if self.max_cols is not None and self.max_cols <= size:
1348            full = size % self.max_cols == 0
1349            layout = (
1350                size // self.max_cols if full else size // self.max_cols + 1,
1351                self.max_cols,
1352            )
1353        else:
1354            layout = 1, size
1355            full = True
1356
1357        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1358            # general figure setup
1359            if self.figure:
1360                fig = self.figure
1361                axes = self.axes
1362            else:
1363                fig = plt.figure(
1364                    clear=True,
1365                    figsize=(2 * layout[1], 2 * layout[0]),
1366                )
1367                gs = fig.add_gridspec(
1368                    nrows=layout[0],
1369                    ncols=layout[1],
1370                    hspace=self.hspace,
1371                    wspace=self.wspace,
1372                )
1373                axes = gs.subplots()
1374                if size == 1:
1375                    axes = np.array([axes])
1376
1377            for (index, name), latex_name in zip(
1378                enumerate(fisher.names),
1379                fisher.latex_names,
1380            ):
1381                ax = axes.flat[index]
1382
1383                _, __, handle = plot_curve_1d(fisher, name, ax, **kwargs)
1384
1385                if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
1386                    self.handles.append(handle)
1387                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
1388                    added = True
1389
1390                for contour_level in self.contour_levels:
1391                    _add_shading_1d(
1392                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1393                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1394                        ax,
1395                        level=contour_level[0],
1396                        alpha=contour_level[1],
1397                        **kwargs,
1398                    )
1399
1400                ax.autoscale()
1401                ax.set_xlabel(latex_name)
1402                ax.relim()
1403                ax.autoscale_view()
1404
1405                # the y axis should start at 0 since we're plotting a PDF
1406                ax.set_ylim(0, ax.get_ylim()[-1])
1407
1408                ax.set_yticks([])
1409
1410                # marking the fiducials
1411                if not mark_fiducials is False:
1412                    if mark_fiducials is True:
1413                        mark_fiducials = dict(linestyles="--", colors="black")
1414
1415                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
1416                        fisher,
1417                        fisher.names[index],
1418                        ax,
1419                        **mark_fiducials,
1420                    )
1421
1422            # remove any axes which are not drawn
1423            if not full:
1424                for index in range(
1425                    size,
1426                    layout[0] * layout[1],
1427                ):
1428                    # it's simpler to turn off the axis, than completely remove
1429                    # it
1430                    axes.flat[index].axis("off")
1431
1432        self._figure = fig
1433        self._axes = axes
1434        self._names = fisher.names

Container for easy access to elements in the 1D plot.

Examples

Define some Fisher matrices:

>>> m1 = FisherMatrix(
... [[3, -2], [-2, 5]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )
>>> m2 = FisherMatrix(
... [[4, 1], [1, 6]],
... names=['a', 'b'],
... latex_names=[r'$\mathcal{A}$', r'$\mathcal{B}$'],
... )

Instantiate a figure:

>>> fig = FisherFigure1D()

Draw marginalized 1D plots with the previously defined Fisher matrix:

>>> fig.plot(m1, label='first')

Add another plot with a different color and style:

>>> fig.plot(m2, label='second', ls=':', color='green')

Draw some other stuff on it:

>>> artist, = fig.draw('a', 'plot', [-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red', label='curve')
>>> # alternatively, the below will accomplish the same thing
>>> # artist, = fig['a'].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')
>>> # note that in this case, due to certain limitations, you need to
>>> # manually add the legend using a convenience function:
>>> # fig.add_artist_to_legend(artist, label='curve')

Add a legend:

>>> _ = fig.legend(ncol=3, loc='center')

Add a title:

>>> _ = fig.set_title('Example Fisher matrix 1D plotting')

Save it to a file:

>>> fig.savefig(
... Path(__file__).parent.parent / os.environ.get("TEMP_IMAGE_DIR", "") / "fisher_figure1d_example1.png",
... dpi=150)

1187            be one of the outputs of `matplotlib.pyplot.style.available`, or a

def draw(self, name: str, method: str, *args, **kwargs): 
1240    def draw(
1241        self,
1242        name: str,
1243        method: str,
1244        *args,
1245        **kwargs,
1246    ):
1247        """
1248        Implements drawing of other objects on the axis.
1249
1250        Parameters
1251        ----------
1252        name : str
1253            the name (label) of the parameter where we want to draw
1254
1255        method : str
1256            the name of the method which we want to plot (such as `plot`,
1257            `scatter`, etc.)
1258
1259        *args
1260            any positional arguments passed to the method (usually some data)
1261
1262        **kwargs
1263            any keyword arguments passed to the method (usually styling options)
1264
1265        Returns
1266        -------
1267        Artist
1268            the artist that was drawn on the figure
1269
1270        Raises
1271        ------
1272        EmptyFigureError
1273            if `figure` is not set
1274        """
1275        if not hasattr(self[name], method):
1276            raise AttributeError(
1277                f"The method `{method}` is not a valid plotting method"
1278            )
1279
1280        # get the right color
1281        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1282            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1283            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1284
1285        # hopefully the return type should be some artist, or a collection of
1286        # artists
1287        handles = getattr(self[name], method)(*args, **kwargs)
1288        if is_iterable(handles):
1289            for handle in handles:
1290                if isinstance(handle, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1291                    self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1292                    self.handles.append(handle)
1293        else:
1294            if isinstance(handles, Artist) and kwargs.get("label"):
1295                self.labels.append(kwargs.get("label"))
1296                self.handles.append(handles)
1297
1298        self[name].autoscale()
1299        self[name].relim()
1300        self[name].autoscale_view()
1301
1302        return handles

def plot( self, fisher: fitk.tensors.FisherMatrix, *args, mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False, **kwargs): 
1304    def plot(
1305        self,
1306        fisher: FisherMatrix,
1307        *args,
1308        mark_fiducials: Union[bool, dict] = False,
1309        **kwargs,
1310    ):
1311        """
1312        Plots the 1D curves of the Fisher objects.
1313
1314        Parameters
1315        ----------
1316        fisher
1317            the Fisher object which we want to plot
1318
1319        mark_fiducials : bool or dict, optional
1320            whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots
1321            (default: False). If set to `True`, uses `linestyles='--'` and
1322            `colors='black'` as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same
1323            keyword arguments as <a
1324            href="https://matplotlib.org/stable/api/collections_api.html#matplotlib.collections.Collection"
1325            target="_blank" rel="noreferrer
1326            noopener">`matplotlib.collections.Collection`</a>.
1327            If an empty dictionary, uses the default style (determined
1328            automatically).
1329
1330        **kwargs
1331            any keyword arguments used for plotting (same as `plot_curve_1d`)
1332
1333        Returns
1334        -------
1335        None
1336        """
1337        size = len(fisher)
1338
1339        added = False
1340
1341        # in order to preserve colors for each object, we only use the
1342        # (default) cycler when the color is not explicitly set
1343        if "c" not in kwargs and "color" not in kwargs:
1344            kwargs["color"] = next(self.current_color)
1345            self.current_color = iter(self.current_color)
1346
1347        if self.max_cols is not None and self.max_cols <= size:
1348            full = size % self.max_cols == 0
1349            layout = (
1350                size // self.max_cols if full else size // self.max_cols + 1,
1351                self.max_cols,
1352            )
1353        else:
1354            layout = 1, size
1355            full = True
1356
1357        with plt.rc_context(self.options):
1358            # general figure setup
1359            if self.figure:
1360                fig = self.figure
1361                axes = self.axes
1362            else:
1363                fig = plt.figure(
1364                    clear=True,
1365                    figsize=(2 * layout[1], 2 * layout[0]),
1366                )
1367                gs = fig.add_gridspec(
1368                    nrows=layout[0],
1369                    ncols=layout[1],
1370                    hspace=self.hspace,
1371                    wspace=self.wspace,
1372                )
1373                axes = gs.subplots()
1374                if size == 1:
1375                    axes = np.array([axes])
1376
1377            for (index, name), latex_name in zip(
1378                enumerate(fisher.names),
1379                fisher.latex_names,
1380            ):
1381                ax = axes.flat[index]
1382
1383                _, __, handle = plot_curve_1d(fisher, name, ax, **kwargs)
1384
1385                if not added and kwargs.get("label"):
1386                    self.handles.append(handle)
1387                    self.labels.append(kwargs["label"])
1388                    added = True
1389
1390                for contour_level in self.contour_levels:
1391                    _add_shading_1d(
1392                        fisher.fiducials[index],
1393                        fisher.constraints(name, marginalized=True),
1394                        ax,
1395                        level=contour_level[0],
1396                        alpha=contour_level[1],
1397                        **kwargs,
1398                    )
1399
1400                ax.autoscale()
1401                ax.set_xlabel(latex_name)
1402                ax.relim()
1403                ax.autoscale_view()
1404
1405                # the y axis should start at 0 since we're plotting a PDF
1406                ax.set_ylim(0, ax.get_ylim()[-1])
1407
1408                ax.set_yticks([])
1409
1410                # marking the fiducials
1411                if not mark_fiducials is False:
1412                    if mark_fiducials is True:
1413                        mark_fiducials = dict(linestyles="--", colors="black")
1414
1415                    _mark_fiducial_1d(
1416                        fisher,
1417                        fisher.names[index],
1418                        ax,
1419                        **mark_fiducials,
1420                    )
1421
1422            # remove any axes which are not drawn
1423            if not full:
1424                for index in range(
1425                    size,
1426                    layout[0] * layout[1],
1427                ):
1428                    # it's simpler to turn off the axis, than completely remove
1429                    # it
1430                    axes.flat[index].axis("off")
1431
1432        self._figure = fig
1433        self._axes = axes
1434        self._names = fisher.names

  • mark_fiducials (bool or dict, optional): whether or not the fiducials should be marked on the plots (default: False). If set to True, uses linestyles='--' and colors='black' as the default. If a dictionary, accepts the same keyword arguments as matplotlib.collections.Collection. If an empty dictionary, uses the default style (determined automatically).

Examples

Setup the plot:

>>> fig = FisherFigure1D()
>>> fig.plot(FisherMatrix(np.diag([1, 2]), names=["a", "b"]), label="Fisher matrix")

Add something to the plot that has a handle:

>>> handle, = fig["a"].plot([-1, 0, 1], [-1, 0, 1], color='red')

... dpi=150)

378

def set_tick_params(self, which: str = 'both', **kwargs): 
425    def set_tick_params(
426        self,
427        which: str = "both",
428        **kwargs,
429    ):
430        """
431        Collectively sets both x and y tick parameters.
432
433        Parameters
434        ----------
435        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
436            which axis to change (default: 'both')
437
438        **kwargs
439            any keyword arguments passed to the methods for handling tick
440            parameters (such as 'fontsize', 'rotation', etc.)
441
442        Returns
443        -------
444        None
445
446        Raises
447        ------
448        EmptyFigureError
449            if `figure` is not set
450        """
451        if not self.figure:
452            raise EmptyFigureError
453
454        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
455            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
456                for item in self[nameiter].get_xticklabels():
457                    for key, value in kwargs.items():
458                        getattr(item, f"set_{key}")(value)
459            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
460                for item in self[nameiter].get_yticklabels():
461                    for key, value in kwargs.items():
462                        getattr(item, f"set_{key}")(value)
463            # also alter any exponential offsets
464            for key, value in kwargs.items():
465                if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
466                    getattr(
467                        self[nameiter].get_xaxis().get_offset_text(),
468                        f"set_{key}",
469                    )(value)
470                if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
471                    getattr(
472                        self[nameiter].get_yaxis().get_offset_text(),
473                        f"set_{key}",
474                    )(value)

476    def set_major_locator(
477        self,
478        locator: Locator,
479        which: str = "both",
480    ):
481        """
482        Sets the major locator for all of the axes.
483
484        Parameters
485        ----------
486        locator
487            the instance of `matplotlib.ticker.Locator` to use.
488
489        which : {'both', 'x', 'y'}
490            which axis to change (default: 'both')
491
492        Returns
493        -------
494        None
495
496        Raises
497        ------
498        EmptyFigureError
499            if `figure` is not set
500        """
501        if not self.figure:
502            raise EmptyFigureError
503
504        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
505            # for some reason, we cannot reuse the same instance, so we just
506            # make a deep copy of it instead
507            if (
508                self[nameiter]
509                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_xticks())
510                and which in ["both", "x"]

516                and np.any(self[nameiter].get_yticks())
517                and which in ["both", "y"]
518            ):
519                yloc = copy.deepcopy(locator)
520                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_locator(yloc)

582

584        -------
585        None

587        Raises
588        ------
589        EmptyFigureError
590            if `figure` is not set
591        """
592        if not self.figure:
593            raise EmptyFigureError
594
595        for nameiter in product(self.names, repeat=self._ndim):
596            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "x"]:
597                self[nameiter].xaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
598            if self[nameiter] and which in ["both", "y"]:
599                self[nameiter].yaxis.set_major_formatter(formatter)
